subject: Relationships
title: Satisfaction: Arranged vs. Love Marriages
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Satisfaction: Arranged vs. Love Marriages.

hook.text: Love marriages start hot and cool down. Arranged marriages start cool and often warm up. Who ends up happier?

buildup.text: Studies show love marriages report higher satisfaction in years 1-5, but arranged marriages catch up by year 10.

discovery.text: Arranged couples enter with lower expectations and more family support â€” two factors that predict long-term success.

twist.text: Satisfaction data is complicated by culture. In arranged marriage cultures, reporting unhappiness carries stigma.

climax.text: Neither model is universally better. Happiness depends on respect, commitment, and compatibility â€” not how you met.

punchline.text: How you meet doesn't predict happiness. How you treat each other does.

quiz.question: What happens to satisfaction in arranged marriages over time?
options: It often increases and matches love marriages by year 10
